description: Requests the validation of a policy and returns a list of findings. The findings help you identify issues and provide actionable recommendations to resolve the issue and enable you to author functional policies that meet security best practices.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The locale to use for localizing the findings.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: A token used for pagination of results returned.

parameters.name: policyDocument
parameters.description: The JSON policy document to use as the content for the policy. The JSON policy document to use as the content for the policy.

parameters.name: policyType
parameters.description:
The type of policy to validate. Identity policies grant permissions to IAM principals. Identity policies include managed and inline policies for IAM roles, users, and groups.
Resource policies grant permissions on Amazon Web Services resources. Resource policies include trust policies for IAM roles and bucket policies for Amazon S3 buckets. You can provide a generic input such as identity policy or resource policy or a specific input such as managed policy or Amazon S3 bucket policy.
Service control policies (SCPs) are a type of organization policy attached to an Amazon Web Services organization, organizational unit (OU), or an account. Identity policies include managed and inline policies for IAM roles, users, and groups. Resource policies grant permissions on Amazon Web Services resources. You can provide a generic input such as identity policy or resource policy or a specific input such as managed policy or Amazon S3 bucket policy. Service control policies (SCPs) are a type of organization policy attached to an Amazon Web Services organization, organizational unit (OU), or an account.

parameters.name: validatePolicyResourceType
parameters.description:
The type of resource to attach to your resource policy. Specify a value for the policy validation resource type only if the policy type is RESOURCE_POLICY. For example, to validate a resource policy to attach to an Amazon S3 bucket, you can choose AWS::S3::Bucket for the policy validation resource type.
For resource types not supported as valid values, IAM Access Analyzer runs policy checks that apply to all resource policies. For example, to validate a resource policy to attach to a KMS key, do not specify a value for the policy validation resource type and IAM Access Analyzer will run policy checks that apply to all resource policies. For example, to validate a resource policy to attach to an Amazon S3 bucket, you can choose AWS::S3::Bucket for the policy validation resource type. For resource types not supported as valid values, IAM Access Analyzer runs policy checks that apply to all resource policies. For example, to validate a resource policy to attach to a KMS key, do not specify a value for the policy validation resource type and IAM Access Analyzer will run policy checks that apply to all resource policies.

nested_items.name: findings
nested_items.description: The list of findings in a policy returned by IAM Access Analyzer based on its suite of policy checks.

nested_items.name: findingDetails
nested_items.description: A localized message that explains the finding and provides guidance on how to address it.

nested_items.name: findingType
nested_items.description: The impact of the finding.

nested_items.name: issueCode
nested_items.description: The issue code provides an identifier of the issue associated with this finding.

nested_items.name: learnMoreLink
nested_items.description: A link to additional documentation about the type of finding.

nested_items.name: locations
nested_items.description: The list of locations in the policy document that are related to the finding. The issue code provides a summary of an issue identified by the finding.

nested_items.name: path
nested_items.description: A path in a policy, represented as a sequence of path elements.

nested_items.name: index
nested_items.description: Refers to an index in a JSON array.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: Refers to a key in a JSON object.

nested_items.name: substring
nested_items.description: Refers to a substring of a literal string in a JSON object.

nested_items.name: start
nested_items.description: The start index of the substring, starting from 0.

nested_items.name: length
nested_items.description: The length of the substring.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: Refers to the value associated with a given key in a JSON object.

nested_items.name: line
nested_items.description: The line of the position, starting from 1.

nested_items.name: column
nested_items.description: The column of the position, starting from 0.

nested_items.name: offset
nested_items.description: The offset within the policy that corresponds to the position, starting from 0.

nested_items.name: line
nested_items.description: The line of the position, starting from 1.

nested_items.name: column
nested_items.description: The column of the position, starting from 0.

nested_items.name: offset
nested_items.description: The offset within the policy that corresponds to the position, starting from 0.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: A token used for pagination of results returned.
